metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6288 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The php_url_parse_ex function in ext/standard/url.c in PHP before 5.5.38 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors involving the smart_str data type.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6288` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1

criterions.comment: hhvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
php7.0 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
